content: -chevron socks- designed by melissa transtrum materials yarn damselfly yarns sturdy sheep 75% merino/25% nylon 400 yards 100gr shown in carnelian needles us 1 5 2 5mm 32 or 40 circular or set of dpns if you use dpns know that the pattern is written for magic loop but you can use them instead you will just have to distribute the stitches differently **please read** if your normal sock needle size is 1 5 go up to a 2 © mel-tran designs 2012 all rights reserved for personal use only page 1 2 75mm because the chevron stitch pulls in on the stitches quite a bit my normal size for socks is a 1 2 25mm just for a reference point notions darning needle sizes 2 available smaller 66sts and larger 72sts gauge 15 sts = 2 take time to check gauge with this pattern or you will have to do like i did and re- make it because it is so tight you can t get it over your heel pattern notes when directions are between * and * repeat them until told otherwise this pattern is written using a short row heel but not everyone likes those and there are some feet that they don t fit as well if you would prefer to do an afterthought heel then instead of knitting the heel section put in the waste yarn for the heel and come back and do it later if you don t like short row heels but don t know how to or what an afterthought heel is there are great videos on youtube or you can go here http //www theknitgirllls com/wordpress/index php/2011/03/tutorial-series-afterthought-heel/ abbreviations co- cast on k- knit p- purl kfb- knit into the front and back of the stitch k2tog- knit 2 stitches together sl 1- slip 1 stitch psso- pass slipped stitch over w&t wrap and turn bring yarn to the front of the work between the needles and slip the next stitch onto the right needle bring the yarn around this stitch to the back of the work then slip the stitch back to the left needle and turn the work to begin working back in the other direction toe to make smaller size follow the first number and for larger follow the number inside co 26 sts 13 on each needle knit across the stitches on each needle once round 1 k1 kfb k across to last 2 sts on first half kfb k1 repeat for other side round 2 k all sts repeat these two row until there are 66 72 sts total foot round 1 *kfb k3 4 sl 1 k2tog psso k3 kfb* to end of 1st needle k all sts on 2nd needle round 2 k all sts around repeat these 2 rounds until foot is 2 inches shorter than total foot length © mel-tran designs 2012 all rights reserved for personal use only page 2 heel *instead of this short row heel feel free to
